solution_line_template: Since {rooms_with_4_windows} rooms have {windows_per_4_window_room} windows, this accounts for {windows_from_4_window_rooms} windows because {windows_per_4_window_room}*{rooms_with_4_windows}=<<{windows_per_4_window_room}*{rooms_with_4_windows}={windows_from_4_window_rooms}>>{windows_from_4_window_rooms} windows.

Since {rooms_with_3_windows} rooms have {windows_per_3_window_room} windows, this accounts for {windows_from_3_window_rooms} windows because {rooms_with_3_windows}*{windows_per_3_window_room}=<<{rooms_with_3_windows}*{windows_per_3_window_room}={windows_from_3_window_rooms}>>{windows_from_3_window_rooms} windows.

There are {remaining_windows} windows left over because {total_windows}-{windows_from_4_window_rooms}-{windows_from_3_window_rooms} = <<{total_windows}-{windows_from_4_window_rooms}-{windows_from_3_window_rooms}={remaining_windows}>>{remaining_windows}.

Therefore, there are {rooms_with_2_windows} rooms with {windows_per_2_window_room} windows because {remaining_windows}/{windows_per_2_window_room} = <<{remaining_windows}/{windows_per_2_window_room}={rooms_with_2_windows}>>{rooms_with_2_windows}.
